choices.text:
in python make a plot that compares two columns in a dataframe.
Sure, here's an example of how you can create a scatterplot comparing the values of two columns in a Pandas DataFrame using Matplotlib library:
```python
import pandas as pd
from matplotlib import pyplot as plt

# Load data from CSV file into a Pandas DataFrame called "data"
df = pd.read_csv('yourfilepath')

# Select columns to compare (in this case, 'column1' and 'column2')
cols = ['column1', 'column2']

# Create scatterplot of column 1 vs column 2 using Matplotlib library
plt.scatter(df[cols].values[[0]], df['column3'])
plt.xlabel('Column 1')
plt.ylabel('Column 2')
plt.title('Scatter Plot Comparison Between Column1 and Column2')
plt.show()
```
